result.execSummary:
The defendant Ivori N Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivori N Winston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ivori N Winston in court with attorney James Toran.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT ONE:
The court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to case 20CF2670. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for ONE YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 25 hours of work per week if in school). Defendant has 30 DAYS to obtain employment.
- Mental health evaluation and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Attend Thinking for Change program
- Defendant must pay $50 fine.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the fine and all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) using cash bond on deposit in cases 20CF2670 and 15CM2478. 

20 day appeal rights given.

JusticePoint DPA Progress Report dated 10-16-2015.  Filed, sdg.
Oral No Contact Order with Bay Shore Mall.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

SPEEDY DISPO.  Defendant Ivori N Winston in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
